writer.name: 伊里亚·蒂尔金 Ilya Tilkin

director.name: 安东·梅格尔季切夫 Anton Megerdichev

introduction: An epic, visually stunning series based on the critically acclaimed novel by one of the most popular Russian authors, Alexei Ivanov, combining historical drama with mystery and fantasy. The 15th century. Sent from Moscow, Prince Yermolay wants to unite all peoples of Perm, Christians and pagans alike. To do so, he, a Christian, seizes the pagans' most powerful artefact, the Golden Woman, or Sorni Nai, only to be killed in battle shortly thereafter. His son Mikhail, however, gains the respect of the locals and marries Tiche, a beautiful, yet mysterious woman. Little does he know that Tiche is the living incarnation of the Sorni Nai: Her supernatural powers and their bond grant him control over Perm. A talented diplomat, Mikhail finds allies among the locals and is able to bring a fragile peace. When news about his increased power reaches Moscow, Grand Prince Ivan III decides to conquer Mikhail and his allies, all part of his plan to unite the disparate peoples of Rus into one powerful state. Torn between his obligations towards his liege and his loyalties towards his allies, Mikhail fights an uphill battle. When Mikhail's former ally Asyka abducts Tiche, everything seems lost. But does Mikhail know all of Tiche's secrets?
